newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia youth group seeks to stop Jackson concert.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia youth group seeks to stop Jackson concert.

text.p: A Malaysian youth group is seeking to halt a concert by U.S. pop star Michael Jackson in Kuala Lumpur this weekend, the national news agency Bernama said on Tuesday.
The news agency quoted Malaysian Youth Council President Suhaimi Ibrahim as saying the pro-Islamic group would submit a petition for an injunction to the High Court "in a day or two".
It was the latest flap in the flamboyant entertainer's Asian tour, which also sparked controversy elsewhere in Malaysia and in South Korea.
Jackson had been scheduled to put on a show in Malaysia's central Selangor state, but local authorities abruptly banned the concert two weeks ago, saying it would have undesirable effects on youth.
The Malaysian cabinet later cleared Jackson to stage concerts, and the capital of Kuala Lumpur offered its stadium.

In South Korea civic and religious groups tried unsuccesfully to keep Jackson out earlier this month. The Ministry of Culture let him perform but said he had to refrain from making "obscene or vulgar gestures or remarks".
The Malaysian youth group, citing a technicality, said the contract for the concert was no longer valid as it was two years old.
